markdownRemark.html:
I just upgraded my Mac to OS X High Sierra (10.13.6). Everything seems to work normally, my existing projects run fine (various React apps and a Laravel app on Docker), until I tried to run npm / npx.

Any npm command returns the error command not found: npm. ðŸ˜±

I checked and found that Node still exists on my machine. I installed Node JS with Homebrew, so I ran brew upgrade npm. After upgrading, I ran npm -v and confirmed NPM is working again on my machine! ðŸŽ‰

Note: If you did not install Node through Homebrew (ie. with installation package from Node website), I recommend uninstalling and doing a fresh install.

frontmatter.title: Fix missing NPM after upgrading to Mac OS High Sierra
